Playing this game makes you feel like you're a punching bag, it hasn't been in an enjoybale state scince 2018. It is the only game I have played with well over 2k hours and I can say confidently that I have 0 faith the game will ever redeem itself, it is the biggest disappointment to ever exist. They made us wait 3 years without anything, just to scrap the promised pve before the game released and waited months into release while still teasing what they promised with pve to say they scrapped it. On top of that pvp has been in shambles for years it has a few bright moments that get derailed by horrible balance changes, they're slow to react with bugs, nerfs, and buffs. The game has been out for 9 months and all they've done is take away a tank and it has destroyed the feeling that this is a team based game, and have taken things away from overwatch and slowly add it back to give the illusion of new features, 9 months in and the same bugs keep reappearing for the same characters with no real fixes. Overpriced skins, the dev team is clueless on whether they want a casual shooter or top of the market comp scene, and they manipulated an entire fan base into thinking the 3 year drought was for something they completely knew before launch wasn't going to ever happen. I DO NOT RECOMEND THIS GAME TO ANYONE.
This garbage makes destiny 2 look like a masterpiece
I'd rather look at the funny new skins than this shit story mode. Very boring don't waste your money. Currently playing Destiny 2.

Is the game still fun? I honestly don't know anymore. 

The reason I'm still playing this game is not because I expect it to be fun, it's because it's the only game I feel like I'm comfortable with, considering with 1000+ hours I have spent on this game. I don't expect the game to be refreshing, I now play it because I wanna get a quick time-wasting, but not as regularly, as happily and as competitively as before. 

The game broke me so many times. I was lucky to experience all the rises and falls from the very beginning, but I kept forgiving the game. As a game dev myself, I know developing a game and maintaining a game is hard, and the situation is always complicated. I used to dream about being a part of the Overwatch team, seeing so much hate targeting Blizzard and Overwatch team, I wanted to see what I could do to contribute, to regain that feeling of delivering a fun game to players and embrace the satisfying moment when players are actually enjoying the game. But with the current state, I hate to say this but my passion for this game is fading away.

Still, I want to thank Overwatch for giving me a wonderful experience. As for the reviews, just look at other negative reviews. 

Farewell, the good old days.
